column4: Anyone here able to help me find and mount an external hard drive that does NOT show under fdisk ?
Run the program "tail -f /var/log/messages", plug the device in and turn it on, and then paste the new output somewhere.
Do you know the filesystem on the device?  Is it just an external drive or a memory card reader?
What /dev/sd* devices do you have?
One of them should be your external drive, and the others your Linux partitions.
You don't have a /dev/sdb?
You start typing my name and hit tab to autocomplete with most programs
easy enough, but that's what shows up
Do "ls /dev | grep sd" and see if you have anything other than /dev/sda
If not, it sounds like it's not being installed as a block device, in which case I can't help any further.  :(
(comma=next line) ptysd,sda, sda1, sda2, sda3, sda4, ttysd
That's weird, but I don't know anything about using dd.  :(  Sorry.
well, thanks for the help thus far, I know a little more than I did when I started.
Let me plug in my external and see what kind of stuff it tells me.
Your drive isn't being read correctly.  I'll paste all of the stuff that pops up for me
http://paste.ubuntu.com/36052/
Sorry, I think I pasted it twice there.
It should be creating a /dev/sdb device.  You may want to try repartitioning it and reformatting it.
Or find a way to make sure it isn't the external device or the adapter inside that's causing the problem.
I'm gonna try and put what I can into my buddies ftp server from my laptop (windows) it reads fine but oh...wait....theres some crazy encription on it right now..
maybe if I remove the encryption, and format it as a basic NTFS filesystem
Yeah, I think that's the problem.  You would have to mount the drive in a special manner to access it with encryption.
